attributes.text:
Core effect “Move”

Moves to element to the given coordinates.

Returns the (computed) value of the property mode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
(Computed) value of mode.

Returns the (computed) value of the property x.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #x}.
(Computed) value of x.

Returns the (computed) value of the property y.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #y}.
(Computed) value of y.
Initial value for property mode.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property mode with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
the default value
Initial value for property x.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property x with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #x}.
the default value
Initial value for property y.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property y with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #y}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property mode.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.

Resets the user value of the property x.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #x}.

Resets the user value of the property y.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #y}.
New value for property mode.

Sets the user value of the property mode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property x.

Sets the user value of the property x.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #x}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property y.

Sets the user value of the property y.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #y}.
The unmodified incoming value.
String indicating if the coordinates are relative to element’s position or absolute.
X coordinate the element should be moved to.
Y coordinate the element should be moved to.
